text: Maxime Marotte (born 5 December 1986, in Mulhouse) is a French mountain bike racer. He rode at the cross-country event at the 2016 Summer Olympics. ==Major results== ;2004 : 3rd Junior cross-country, World Mountain Bike Championships ;2011 : 1st 20px Mixed relay, World Mountain Bike Championships : 1st 20px Mixed relay, European Mountain Bike Championships : 2nd National Cross-country Championships : 5th Overall UCI Mountain Bike World Cup ;2012 : 2nd Mixed relay, World Mountain Bike Championships : 3rd National Cross-country Championships ;2013 : 2nd Mixed relay, World Mountain Bike Championships : 3rd National Cross-country Championships : 9th Overall UCI Mountain Bike World Cup ;2014 : 1st 20px Mixed relay, World Mountain Bike Championships : 1st 20px Mixed relay, European Mountain Bike Championships : 2nd National Cross-country Marathon Championships : 10th Overall UCI Mountain Bike World Cup ;2015 : 1st 20px National Cross-country Marathon Championships : 2nd National Cross- country Championships : 7th Overall UCI Mountain Bike World Cup ;2016 : 2nd National Cross-country Championships : 3rd Overall UCI Mountain Bike World Cup : 4th Cross-country, Summer Olympics ;2017 : 1st 20px National Cross-country Championships : 3rd Overall UCI Mountain Bike World Cup ;2018 : 3rd Overall UCI Mountain Bike World Cup : 3rd National Cross-country Championships ==References== ==External links== * Category:1986 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Mulhouse Category:French male cyclists Category:Cyclists at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic cyclists of France Category:Université Savoie-Mont Blanc alumni Category:Cyclists at the 2015 European Games Category:European Games competitors for France
title: Maxime Marotte
